availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles W. King (Pendleton County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, resident. Bracken County, Kentucky, native. Married to Sarah King. Father of Alphus Nelson King, Arvilla N King, and Hamon M King. Farmer in Bracken County in 1860. Served in the 18th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as Corporal from October 21, 1861 to November 7, 1862. Medically discharged on November 7, 1862. Resident in Pendleton County in 1864.

ab.bibl:

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 313.
